did.unittitle: College of Physicians of Philadelphia Library records

bioghist.p: Established in 1788, the Library of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia was Philadelphia’s central medical library for over 150 years, serving its medical schools, hospitals, physicians and other health professionals. Today, it is an independent research library devoted to the history of medicine and serves hundreds of scholars, health professionals, students and popular writers each year. In addition to its rare books and nineteenth- and twentieth-century collections, the College Library is notable for its manuscripts and archives. Within this collection are the College’s own archives, the archives of other Philadelphia medical institutions, and letters, case books, and student notebooks that document the personal life and professional practice of doctors in the Philadelphia region and around the world.

scopecontent.p: This collection documents both the Public Services and Historical Collections functions of the Library of the College of Physicians of Philadelphia. The collection ranges in date from the late nineteenth to the twenty-first century and includes papers of several Librarians, Curators of Historical Collections, and other Library staff members, including Thomas A. Horrocks, Marjorie Smink, Christine Ruggere, Anthony A. Aguirre, Ellen Gatrell, Charles Greifenstein, Andrea Kenyon, and Sofie Sereda. Programs and College Sections documented in the collection include: PhillyHealthInfo.org, Consumer Health Information Network (CHINET), Community Health Information Center (CHIC), Medical Documentation Service (MDS), Mid-Eastern Regional Medical Library Service (MERMLS), the Strategic Core Planning Group, the Samuel Lewis Circle, and the Sections on Arts and Medicine and Public Health. Outside professional organizations and consortia documented in the collection include the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL), the Delaware Valley Archivists Group (DVAG), the Mid-Atlantic Regional Archives Conference (MARAC), the American Osler Society, and the Health Sciences Library Consortium, This collection includes extensive documentation of the administration of the College Library, including records of librarians and curators of historical collections and records of the Mid-Eastern Regional Medical Library Service (MERMLS). Administrative files date from 1882 to 2000, and include: correspondence, meeting minutes and agendas, newsletters, financial records, budgets and planning documents, personnel records, correspondence, grant proposals and reports, subject and research files, and exhibit files. Also included among the administrative files are clippings and publicity information, conservation assessments, records of loans to other institutions, personnel files of MDS staff (1959-1989), records related to the Strategic Planning Core Group, records related to the Samuel Lewis Circle, floor plans of the library’s reading room and stacks, interlibrary loan reports, letterpress volumes of correspondence (1882-1932), binder’s books (1882-1895 and 1920-1935), lists of information resources on consumer health and public health, audiocassettes of lectures and programs. MERMLS records date from 1962 to 1983 and include: director’s files, publications, workshop materials, grant applications, annual reports, correspondence, and questionnaires. The collection also includes detailed documentation of library usage and holdings. These materials include circulation and call slips, circulation statistics, OCLC statistics, correspondence about reference requests, photo requests, document delivery statistics, online searches, patron surveys, acquisitions, records of gifts, information on duplicate books, a 1930 inventory of archives in the vault, lists of materials in offsite storage, inventories of the Radbill book collection, an inventory of incunabula, library policies and procedures, MDS data input forms, and appointment books from Public Services, 2003-2005. Documentation of specific programs involving the Library’s Public Services division include records of CHINET: budgets, minutes, information packets, correspondence, and reports, 1983-1985; records of Philly Health Info such as correspondence, reports, statistics, surveys, evaluations, printed materials, training manuals, and banners, 2002-2005; and records of CHIC: catalogs of journal held by CPP, reference correspondence, usage statistics, and reports. Documentation of publication projects involving the Library include: catalog entries for the manuscript guide, 1953-1982; proofs of the Portrait Catalog; articles and notes related to Fugitive Leaves; and printed brochures and catalogues.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
